1.subquestion: Convert Adam's current height from inches to feet.

subanswer.text: There are 12 inches in one foot, therefore Adam's height converted to feet would be 40 / 12 = 3.33 (rounded down). The answer is approximately 3.33 feet.

2.subquestion: Find out how many additional inches or feet will make up the required height difference between now and when Adam reaches exactly 4 feet.

subanswer.text: To reach exactly 4 feet (or precisely), Adam needs an extra 4 - 3.33 = 0.67 feet. Converting back to inches yields 0.67 * 12 = 8.04 inches (since you cannot grow part of an inch physically, let's consider full growth increments; thus rounding off makes sense here too). Thus, Adam might need about 8 inches plus however small fraction remains uncounted due to partial growing—so roughly estimated another whole year since he gains 2 inches per year. Hence our approximate rounded figure suggests just over one single year needed under ideal conditions where no other factors affect height gain rate – but always keeping biological variability & individual circumstances also important!
